posts.description: It’s time for news organizations to embrace Creative Commons – Poynter
posts.extended: For the past several years, Cards Against Humanity has been Amazon’s No. 1 bestseller in the “Toys and Games” category. But the card game, which has raked in millions of dollars and inspired dozens of imitations, is also available for free on the Cards Against Humanity website.

posts.description: ISIS and the 'Propaganda of the Deed' - The Atlantic
posts.extended: In the immediate aftermath of the attacks in Brussels on Tuesday, there was a period in which members of the Western news media were scouring for evidence of who might be behind them. Suspicion primarily fell on ISIS, which managed to pull off a complex, multi-target attack in Paris four months ago.

posts.extended: The night before Super Tuesday I was on a plane from Oklahoma City to Cleveland, my hometown, when a thought struck me: I truly had no idea what was going on in America. I’d been traveling a fair bit during the rush of primary season, and you start to feel unstuck when you do that.

posts.description: Inside the Wild ‘Full House’ Porn Parody - The Daily Beast
posts.extended: Pegged to the release of Netflix’s spinoff series ‘Fuller House,’ porn parody maestro Lee Roy Myers has just unveiled a NSFW take on the show that made John Stamos a star. Pornhub is branching out, turning the beloved ‘90s sitcom Full House into a sex-com.
